data.title: Disable dev and player commands for observers
data.body: Fixes #6839

data.title: Moved Tooltip to Mods.Common.Traits
data.body:
As title says.

Note: I think this is pretty much it for low-hanging fruits. To make any more progress of significance, we'll have to move
- Buildings,
- Movement/Pathfinding stuff,
- Armaments/Attack,
- most Render traits.

Until we get over this one larger hurdle, we'll be pretty much stuck, since most other stuff (AI, Activities, Upgrades, SupportPowers, Player traits, tons of misc traits, and so on) is tied to at least one of these.

data.title: Lua API : Added floating text and radar video
data.body:
This adds two new functions to the Media lua api.
1. FloatingText (string text, WPos position, int duration = 30) displays a text at the specified location.
2. LoadMovieAsync(string movie, LuaFunction func) and 
    PlayMovieInRadar(VqaReader reader, LuaFunction func = null) plays a video over the ingame radar which is used in some CnC campaigns

The simplest way to use the latter is Media.LoadMovieAsync("[videoName].vqa", Media.PlayMovieInRadar), but lua callbacks [func(VqaReader video)] are supported as well as storing the video in a global lua variable.

data.title: Use ActorMap instead of BuildingInfluence for finding buildable area
data.body: This allows for any actors (previously only those tagged as a `Building`) to work with `GivesBuildableArea`. This costs some performance as it will check all actors within the scan radius for the proper criteria, not just buildings.

data.title: OpenRA touchscreen interface proposal.
data.body:
Hi guys. I don't know if this is the right place to post this, but I've seen some bugs labeld as "Feature" so I'm going ahead. Recently, I've had a few ideas about a touch interface for OpenRA. Lots of cheap touch embeded windows devices have come up, I have one myself (Asus Transformer T100) and I would love to be able to play ORA with only the touchsceen. As it is, it's very hard to play on the touchscreen, it feels clumsy - so after looking over a few RTS games that have touch support, I mocked up some UI pictures. Please have a look and tell me what you think!

First one is a basic UI that integrates scrolling buttons that pan the camera. Not very pretty, but functional. It also has grouping buttons that emulate 1-7 on the keyboard as well as the CTRL key.

![openra simple touch interface proposal 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6204538/5504891/ae5c8286-8792-11e4-81cb-2387bc5c62df.jpg)

The second one uses a virtual Thumbstick for camera controls. I think this is the most elegant as it takes up less screen real estate - but it's probably the hardest to implement. It also has the grouping buttons.

![openra simple touch interface proposal 2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6204538/5504921/36a2f896-8793-11e4-9f53-1d365c571b94.jpg)

Besides these UI changes, the engine hould also be able to understand multitouch. For example:
- one finger touch selects a unit, or issues orders (left click)
- one finger touch and hold drags a selection box
- two finger touch deselects the units (right click)
- tree finger hold pans the camera (middle mouse)

With these changes, the game would be comfortable on any touch device, and could also be ported to android. Please tell me what you think.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/7136369-openra-touchscreen-interface-proposal?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Extract activities from AttackCharge and AttackOmni
data.body:
...and move them into their own files in Activities.

Note: In my own attempt I succeeded extracting `SetTarget` from `AttackOmni`, but failed with both `Charge*` activities from `AttackCharge` since I couldn't resolve issues with access/protection levels, so someone else with better understanding of the matter will have to tackle this.

data.title: Add more resources to the D2k mod
data.body:
1. With the map importer for Dune 2000 maps in the making (#7135), we will need a few more things:
   **a) add "missing" tiles to the `arrakis.yaml` tileset file**
   While we (_may, but questionably_) have all different tiles referenced in the file and this is good enough for the map editor, the map import does not have everything it needs (terrain-wise), which results in incorrect tiles (nothing deal-breaking, but they have to be then manually replaced via the map editor). I've gone over this in several other tickets and on IRC. (#5875)
   **b) add House Corrino, Fremen, Smugglers and Mercenaries as non-playable subfactions**
   This is required for importing missions.
2. Also I am adding a few voice notifications that we are not, but should be using.
   a) The code that will use the `EnemyUnitsApproaching` notification is currently being worked on.
   b) `Guarding` should really be used by the existing Guard command.
   c) Once the new UI is in place and the upgrades for the production structures are implemented, the `Upgrading` notification should be used. (#6043, #3211)
3. Please don't bash me for the empty `corrino.yaml`. I will need some advice on what structures does this faction have that are visually different from the other houses to populate it properly.
4. Added a few more loading screen messages :)

data.title: Add Unit158 to AUTHORS
Windows uninstaller does not error if OpenRA is currently running.
data.body: Instead of aborting the uninstaller, the script removes any files which are not locked by the process when the process is running. The expected behavior is to either abort the script, or wait until the process is closed to continue.

data.title: Generate sync reports faster
data.body:
Avoid calling ToString on value types until they are written to disk.

Values for the report are generated by calling ToString on members, we avoid calling this on value types for performance. By instead just copying the value we can delay calling ToString until later and avoid spending time and memory creating strings that usually go unused.

On the RA shellmap, overall CPU time spent capturing these values has been reduced from 1.4% to 0.3%.

The project Mono.Nat is nearly dead. 

Since mono-nat (respectively as the old name) is retired in Fedora and can not be wake up easily, I would like to know how far the plan is to migrate to Open.NAT as promised already in some other issue (number unkonwn?).

data.title: Applys decloak to units activating a C4 demolition or infiltrate ability
data.body:
Closes #7028

Units which have a cloak and a C4/infiltrate ability will now decloak upon exiting the target building. Of course infiltration normally consumes the unit, so there will be no actual impact in that case. However infiltration was included in the original feature request, so applying the change to both allows for the possibility of a reusable infiltration unit.

data.body:
What I want, is then no sound actor is defined (old maps), then standard is used.
This way we need to update less, and old maps could be played without needing hard to use update (comparing yaml's)

See also #7136

data.title: D2k: Add map importer
data.body:
This is my initial attempt to create a map importer for Dune 2000 .MAP files. (#4281)
Current status:
- Imports terrain
- Imports resources (spice)
- Imports actors (neutral, atreides and harkonnen; I will add the rest soon)

Issues:
- Missing tiles from arrakis.yaml tileset file  (#5875)
- Currently cannot add player references for mission maps

This is 90% working with skirmish maps (from what I've seen), excluding 10% for the missing tiles.
While this will import mission maps as well, the player reference issue does cause some problems there. This can be manually fixed in the `map.yaml` for now. I plan on fixing it properly when there is a Dune 2000 mission file reader implemented (#4280).

data.title: Introduce map Class field to replace Selectable/UseAsShellmap
data.body: This cleans up some uglyness in the current map format and generalizes the map chooser for use by the ingame map editor.

data.title: Reorganise Mods.D2k, more reorganisation for Mods.RA
Enforce code style rules using travis-ci
data.body:
We can reduce our review workload by integrating Stylecop with our `make test` rule (run on travis) to catch many of the basic style issues.  http://stylecopplus.codeplex.com/ appears to add some more useful style rules.

https://github.com/enckse/travis-mono-scripts appears to include a script for running Stylecop on travis.

We can enable this on a project-by-project basis once we clean up the existing style issues in each.

data.title: Infantry should return to standing or prone frames between firing
data.body:
In the original TD/RA1/D2k infantry returned to their standing or prone stances between each shot while in OpenRA they freeze on the last fire frame. IMO it'd look a lot better if they returned to their standing/prone frames just like the original games.

It'd fix the issue where infantry stay in their fire frames after shooting but are actually turning around or doing some other action.

It would also fix the following issue in D2k: D2k infantry's last fire frames have muzzle flashes which means they 'freeze mid shot' and it all looks rather silly. The other alternative to fix this would be to loop back to the first fire frame for D2k but I think the above change would be generally better.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/7008018-infantry-should-return-to-standing-or-prone-frames-between-firing?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>
